seisflows3.workflow.migration

This is the base class seisflows.workflow.migration

This is a main Seisflows class, it controls the main workflow.

seisflows3.workflow.migration.postprocess
class seisflows3.workflow.migration.Migration

Bases: custom_import('workflow', 'base')

Migration base class.

Performs the workflow of an inversion up to the postprocessing. In the terminology of seismic exploration, implements a ‘reverse time migration’.

logger
property required(self)

A hard definition of paths and parameters required by this class, alongside their necessity for the class and their string explanations.

main(self, return_flow=False)

s Migrates seismic data to generate sensitivity kernels

Parameters

return_flow (bool) – for CLI tool, simply returns the flow function rather than running the workflow. Used for print statements etc.

setup(self)

Sets up the SeisFlows3 modules for the Migration

generate_synthetics(self)

Performs forward simulation, and evaluates the objective function

backproject(self)

Backproject or create kernels by running adjoint simulations

process_kernels(self)

Backproject to create kernels from synthetics

finalize(self)

Saves results from current model update iteration

save_kernels_sum(self)

Same summed kernels into the output directory

save_kernels(self)

Save individual kernels into the output directory

save_traces(self)

Save waveform traces into the output directory
